body:
As I know it is not possible to load two Gemfiles at once, maybe @wycats could help us here find a good solution ... 

I'm not sure if rvm gemsets is a good thing to depend on in rails tests, but we can use a trick with custom GEM_HOME where we install everything to and it will be available without any dependencies on environment, that could be easily done in .travis.yml + documented ( I have no clue where ).

I guess this would make the tests a bit longer - but more important existing tests that were supposed to run `bundle install` need to reviewed if they were run in context of proper `Gemfile`.
